messages.message: I’d personally prefer that the default behavior is that we load the notebook, but I understand that argument against it. Every notebook environment I’ve used loads up a notebook by default if you click on it. On a related note, for most files on Instabase we open the preview by default, instead of the editor. As a developer on Instabase I think this feature blocks usability. 99% of the time, if I’m opening a file, it’s because I want to edit it.
May be out of scope to consider, but some thing to track for konmari, @John Hung
Would love to know which files these are, because I thought I got most of them in that PR above
I’ve got this issue on the Usability board: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/UI-50 I agree it’d be a great thing to get to during konmari week, if we haven’t already
I did notice that .py files now open by default in the editor
The ticket I filed is for json files
I actually agree with this too. Almost every time I'm opening preview it's by accident and so I can open it in a different app.
mm yeah I didn't do that one - that's a good one to add
